translated: This is called the Buddha of mind.üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is the Buddha of wisdom?

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Buddha of essential nature?

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas ni gnas ngan len gyi gnas gyur pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas ni gnas ngan len gyi gnas gyur pa /
translated: The Buddha of essential nature is the transformation of the basis of the propensities for misknowledge.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: It is inconceivable.

original: dri ma med pa /
analyzed: dri ma med pa /
translated: It is stainless.

original: gzugs sna tshogs can /
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs can /
translated: It is endowed with various forms.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam pa tha dad pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam pa tha dad pa /
translated: It is the various aspects of the realm of the Dharma.

original: gzugs dang / byad dang / dbyibs sna tshogs pa /
analyzed: gzugs dang / byad dang / dbyibs sna tshogs pa /
translated: It is endowed with various forms, shapes, and bodies.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su snang ba 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su snang ba 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyi sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: The appearance of the form of the Buddha endowed with the thirty-two marks of the great person is called the Buddha of essential nature.

original: de la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Buddha of communal enjoyment?

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / longs spyod dang / kun tu spyod pa mtshungs pa dang / rnam pa dang / zas dang / smra ba dang / cho ga dang / spyod pa mtshungs pa 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / longs spyod dang / kun tu spyod pa mtshungs pa dang / rnam pa dang / zas dang / smra ba dang / cho ga dang / spyod pa mtshungs pa 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who is of equal enjoyment and equal practice with the bodhisattvas, equal in form, food, speech, conduct, and behavior is called the Buddha of communal enjoyment.

original: de la sprul pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sprul pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
translated: What is an emanation buddha?üîΩHere, the buddhas and bodhisattvas have attained the meditative absorption that displays all forms.

original: 'di la sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpas gzugs thams cad ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de dag ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpas gzugs thams cad ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de dag ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Having entered into that meditative absorption,

original: dbang thob cing snying rje chen pos bskul bas sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su sprul nas sems @17a *//
analyzed: dbang thob cing snying rje chen pos bskul bas sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su sprul nas sems @17a *//
translated: they emanate in the form of a buddha out of a desire to tame sentient beings.

original: can rnams 'dul ba 'di ni sprul pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: can rnams 'dul ba 'di ni sprul pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called an emanation buddha.

original: de la btags pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la btags pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
translated: What is a nominal buddha?

original: 'di la la zhig slob dpon nam mkhan po la sangs rgyas bzhin du blta /
analyzed: 'di la la zhig slob dpon nam mkhan po la sangs rgyas bzhin du blta /
translated: Here, someone regards their teacher or preceptor as a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bzhin du bsnyen bkur byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhin du bsnyen bkur byed de /
translated: They serve them as they would a buddha.üîΩBecause they regard their teacher or preceptor as a buddha and serve them as they would a buddha,

original: de slob dpon dang / mkhan po de la sangs rgyas bzhin du blta zhing sangs rgyas bzhin du bsnyen bkur byas pas; de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rab tu 'dzin la yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: de slob dpon dang / mkhan po de la sangs rgyas bzhin du blta zhing sangs rgyas bzhin du bsnyen bkur byas pas; de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rab tu 'dzin la yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: they will fully perfect the qualities of a buddha.

original: yongs su bsgrub pa 'di ni btags pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsgrub pa 'di ni btags pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the ‚Äònominal buddha. ‚Äô

original: de la mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the buddha that is placed in front?

original: 'di la la la zhig gis sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs byas sam /
analyzed: 'di la la la zhig gis sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs byas sam /
translated: Here someone makes a buddha image,

original: byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: byed du bcug ste /
translated: or has one made,

original: mchod cing rim gro bya ba thams cad kyis bsti stang du byed /
analyzed: mchod cing rim gro bya ba thams cad kyis bsti stang du byed /
translated: and honors it with all kinds of offerings and services,

original: bla mar byed; ri mor byed cing /
analyzed: bla mar byed; ri mor byed cing /
translated: and venerates it,

original: de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rab tu 'dzin la yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rab tu 'dzin la yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: and retains and perfects the qualities of the Buddha.

original: yongs su bsgrub pa 'di ni mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su bsgrub pa 'di ni mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the ‚Äòbuddha that is placed in front. ‚Äô

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcu po de dag gis sangs rgyas khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcu po de dag gis sangs rgyas khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: bodhisattvas should understand the Buddha through these ten principles of the way of Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi tha snyad du ston pa rnam pa bcur khong du tshud par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi tha snyad du ston pa rnam pa bcur khong du tshud par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva should understand the ten types of conventional teachings of the tathƒÅgatas, the saints, the perfectly enlightened ones.

original: rnam pa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: phung po @17b ston pa dang / khams ston pa dang / skye mched ston pa dang / sems can ston pa dang / las ston pa dang / skye ba ston pa dang / rga ba ston pa dang / 'chi ba ston pa dang / shi ba'i nyir mtshams sbyor ba ston pa dang /
analyzed: phung po @17b ston pa dang / khams ston pa dang / skye mched ston pa dang / sems can ston pa dang / las ston pa dang / skye ba ston pa dang / rga ba ston pa dang / 'chi ba ston pa dang / shi ba'i nyir mtshams sbyor ba ston pa dang /
translated: the teaching of the aggregates, the teaching of the elements, the teaching of the sense bases, the teaching of sentient beings, the teaching of karma, the teaching of birth, the teaching of aging, the teaching of death, the teaching of the rebirth of the dead,

original: de rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: de rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa'o //
translated: and the teaching of nirvƒÅ·πáa, which is their complete pacification.

original: de la ji ltar na phung po ston pa tha snyad du ston ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na phung po ston pa tha snyad du ston ce na /
translated: How does the teaching of the aggregates constitute a conventional teaching?

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The form aggregate does not exist ultimately.

original: gal te gzugs kyi phung po don dam par yod du zin na ni de yongs su btang bas srid pa 'chad par 'gyur te /üîΩgang yongs su btang nas grol ba de la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te gzugs kyi phung po don dam par yod du zin na ni de yongs su btang bas srid pa 'chad par 'gyur te / gang yongs su btang nas grol ba de la gnas pa'am /
translated: If the form aggregate existed ultimately, then existence would be severed by its abandonment.

original: 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If one were liberated by abiding in or going to that which is abandoned,üîΩit would not be so.

original: de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po ston pa tha snyad du ston pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po ston pa tha snyad du ston pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the form aggregate is a conventional teaching.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po ston pa dang / 'du shes kyi phung po ston pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung po ston pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po ston pa dang / 'du shes kyi phung po ston pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung po ston pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, the teaching of the feeling aggregate, the teaching of the perception aggregate, the teaching of the formation aggregate, and the teaching of the consciousness aggregate are conventional teachings.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The consciousness aggregate does not exist ultimately.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa'i phung po don dam par yod du zin na ni de yongs su btang bas srid pa 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa'i phung po don dam par yod du zin na ni de yongs su btang bas srid pa 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: If the consciousness aggregate existed ultimately, then existence would be severed by its abandonment.

original: gang yongs su btang nas grol ba de la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gang yongs su btang nas grol ba de la gnas pa'am /
translated: If one were liberated by abiding in or going to that which is abandoned,üîΩit would not be so.

original: 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba zhig na; de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i phung po ston pa tha snyad du ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba zhig na; de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i phung po ston pa tha snyad du ston pa'o //
translated: If there were any going, it would be so. But since that is not the case, therefore the teaching of the aggregate of consciousness is a conventional teaching.

original: de bzhin du khams ston pa dang / skye mched ston pa ni tha snyad du ston pa'o //üîΩde la ji ltar na @18a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du khams ston pa dang / skye mched ston pa ni tha snyad du ston pa'o // de la ji ltar na @18a *//
translated: Similarly, the teaching of the elements and the teaching of the sense bases are conventional teachings.

original: sems can du ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems can du ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
translated: In that regard, how is the teaching of sentient beings a conventional teaching?

original: sems can ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Sentient beings do not exist ultimately.

original: de ni chos tsam du zad pas sems can med do //
analyzed: de ni chos tsam du zad pas sems can med do //
translated: Since they are just mere phenomena, sentient beings do not exist.

original: gal te sems can yod du zin na ni phung po 'gags pas na nam mkha' bzhin du sems can phung po med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te sems can yod du zin na ni phung po 'gags pas na nam mkha' bzhin du sems can phung po med par 'gyur la /
translated: If sentient beings did exist, then due to the cessation of the aggregates, sentient beings would be without aggregates, like space.

original: phung po bzhin du sems can yang 'dus ma byas su 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: phung po bzhin du sems can yang 'dus ma byas su 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: And like the aggregates, sentient beings would be unconditioned.

original: de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir sems can ston pa tha snyad du ston pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir sems can ston pa tha snyad du ston pa'o //
translated: But since that is not the case, therefore the teaching of sentient beings is a conventional teaching.

original: de la ji ltar na las ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na las ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
translated: In that regard, how is the teaching of karma a conventional teaching?

original: las rnams byed pa yod pa'ang ma yin /üîΩmed pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: las rnams byed pa yod pa'ang ma yin / med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that karma is not produced.

original: gal te las rnams byed pa zhig yod du zin na ni las rnams byed pa nam mkha' bzhin du ma byas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te las rnams byed pa zhig yod du zin na ni las rnams byed pa nam mkha' bzhin du ma byas par 'gyur la /
translated: If karma were produced, then karma would be unproduced, like space.

original: phung po bzhin du 'dus byas su'ang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: phung po bzhin du 'dus byas su'ang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: And it would be produced, like the aggregates.

original: ma byas pa ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: ma byas pa ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
translated: But what is unproduced is like space.

original: ma byas pa rnams byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa rnams byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: What is unproduced is not produced.

original: de'i phyir las gang la'ang byed pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir las gang la'ang byed pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no producer of any karma.

original: de med pas na las yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med pas na las yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Since that does not exist, how could karma exist?

original: de'i phyir las ston pa tha snyad du ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir las ston pa tha snyad du ston pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of karma is a conventional teaching.

original: de la ji ltar na skye ba ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na skye ba ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the teaching of arising a conventional teaching?

original: skye ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Arising does not exist ultimately.

original: gal te skye ba don dam par yod du zin na ni rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skye ba don dam par yod du zin na ni rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: If arising existed ultimately, it would be permanent.

original: de ltar na skye ba ni skye ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na skye ba ni skye ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, arising would be nonarising.

original: gang skyes pas skye ba dang / skye bas gzir bar 'gyur ba de'ang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang skyes pas skye ba dang / skye bas gzir bar 'gyur ba de'ang med par 'gyur te /
translated: That which is born and that which is oppressed by birth do not exist.

original: de'i phyir skye ba ston pa tha snyad @18b du ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba ston pa tha snyad @18b du ston pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of birth is a conventional teaching.

original: de la ji ltar na rga ba ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na rga ba ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the teaching of aging a conventional teaching?

original: rga ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rga ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Aging does not exist ultimately.

original: gal te rga ba don dam par yod du zin na ni gang yang rgas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rga ba don dam par yod du zin na ni gang yang rgas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If aging existed ultimately, then no one would age.

original: gang rgas pa de ni gzhon nu'ang ma yin /üîΩrgan po'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gang rgas pa de ni gzhon nu'ang ma yin / rgan po'ang ma yin /
translated: One who ages is neither young nor old.

original: rnying pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: rnying pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: One who ages is neither new nor old.

original: byis pa la'ang rgas pa med de /
analyzed: byis pa la'ang rgas pa med de /
translated: Aging does not exist for a child.

original: de'i phyir byis pa ni rga bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir byis pa ni rga bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, a child does not age.

original: rga ba med na ji ltar na rga bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rga ba med na ji ltar na rga bar 'gyur /
translated: If there is no aging, how could one age?

original: de ltar ma rgas pa ni rga bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma rgas pa ni rga bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who does not age does not age.

original: gal te rgas pa rga bar 'gyur na rga ba gzhon nur yang ji ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rgas pa rga bar 'gyur na rga ba gzhon nur yang ji ste mi 'gyur /
translated: If one who ages ages, then why does aging not become youth?

original: de'i phyir rga ba ston pa'ang tha snyad du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rga ba ston pa'ang tha snyad du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of aging is a conventional teaching.

original: de la ji ltar na 'chi ba ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na 'chi ba ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the teaching of death conventional?

original: 'chi ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Death does not exist ultimately.

original: gal te 'chi ba don dam par yod du zin na ni gzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'chi ba don dam par yod du zin na ni gzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If death existed ultimately, it would be apprehended.

original: gcig gis bzung bas srog chags gzhan thams cad mi 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /üîΩmi 'chi bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig gis bzung bas srog chags gzhan thams cad mi 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i rigs na / mi 'chi bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were apprehended by one, it would be reasonable that all other living beings would not die.üîΩBut it is not so.

original: 'chi ba ni ga las kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: 'chi ba ni ga las kyang mi 'ong /
translated: Death does not come from anywhere, nor does it go anywhere.

original: gang du'ang mi 'gro bas 'chi ba ni stong pa ste; de'i phyir 'chi ba ston pa tha snyad du ston pa'o //
analyzed: gang du'ang mi 'gro bas 'chi ba ni stong pa ste; de'i phyir 'chi ba ston pa tha snyad du ston pa'o //
translated: Therefore, death is empty. Thus, the teaching of death is a conventional teaching.

original: de la ji ltar na shi ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na shi ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the teaching of the connection between death and birth a conventional teaching?

original: shi ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shi ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ni don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The connection between death and birth does not exist ultimately.

original: gal te shi ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ni don dam par yod du zin na ni gang 'chi ba de nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shi ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ni don dam par yod du zin na ni gang 'chi ba de nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the connection between death and birth existed ultimately, then the one who dies would be born.

original: de ltar shi ba nyid skye bar 'gyur na ni gang nyid mtshams @19a *//
analyzed: de ltar shi ba nyid skye bar 'gyur na ni gang nyid mtshams @19a *//
translated: If one who dies is born, then one who dies would be unborn.üîΩ

original: sbyor ba dang / gang du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i lus gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / gang du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i lus gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: If death itself were to be born, then there would be two bodies: the one in which the being dies and the one in which it is born.

original: gal te nying mtshams sbyor ba zhig yod du zin na ni phung po lnga rnams kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nying mtshams sbyor ba zhig yod du zin na ni phung po lnga rnams kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a being that is born, then there would be five aggregates.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phung po las rnam par grol ba'i rnam par shes pa 'jug pa med de /
analyzed: phung po las rnam par grol ba'i rnam par shes pa 'jug pa med de /
translated: Apart from the aggregates, there is no consciousness that can be engaged.

original: gzugs la nye bar 'gro zhing rnam par shes pa 'jug go /
analyzed: gzugs la nye bar 'gro zhing rnam par shes pa 'jug go /
translated: Consciousness is engaged in relation to form.

original: rnam par shes pa ni tshor ba la nye bar 'gro /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni tshor ba la nye bar 'gro /
translated: Consciousness is engaged in relation to feeling,

original: 'du shes la nye bar 'gro /üîΩ'du byed la nye bar 'gro zhing de la rten /
analyzed: 'du shes la nye bar 'gro / 'du byed la nye bar 'gro zhing de la rten /
translated: in relation to perception,üîΩand in relation to volitional factors.

original: de la dmigs te rnam par shes pa 'jug go /
analyzed: de la dmigs te rnam par shes pa 'jug go /
translated: Consciousness is engaged in relation to them, it is supported by them, and it is based on them.

original: mi rten pa'i rnam par shes pa ni skad cig tsam yang 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: mi rten pa'i rnam par shes pa ni skad cig tsam yang 'jug pa med do //
translated: Without a support, consciousness does not engage even for a moment.

original: ji ltar chos gnas pa bzhin du sa bon dang / myu gu ltar 'byung bas de'i phyir shi ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ston pa ni tha snyad du ston pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar chos gnas pa bzhin du sa bon dang / myu gu ltar 'byung bas de'i phyir shi ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba ston pa ni tha snyad du ston pa'o //
translated: Since the connection between death and rebirth occurs in accordance with the way things are, like a seed and a sprout, therefore the teaching of the connection between death and rebirth is a conventional teaching.

original: de la ji ltar na de zhi bar 'gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na de zhi bar 'gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa tha snyad du ston pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the teaching of nirvana, which is the pacification of that, a conventional teaching?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nirvana does not exist ultimately,

original: 'khor ba nye bar zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //üîΩ'khor ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba nye bar zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o // 'khor ba nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: because the pacification of cyclic existence is called nirvana.üîΩCyclic existence is not nirvana,

original: 'khor ba las mya ngan las 'das pa tha dad du gyur pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba las mya ngan las 'das pa tha dad du gyur pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: and nirvana is not different from cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba de'ang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba de'ang rmi lam lta bu sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: Cyclic existence is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: yod pas kyang ma yin /üîΩmed pas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: yod pas kyang ma yin / med pas kyang ma yin /
translated: It does not arise from existence,üîΩnor does it arise from nonexistence,

original: yod med du gyur pas kyang mi 'byung ngo //üîΩji ltar de yod pas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: yod med du gyur pas kyang mi 'byung ngo // ji ltar de yod pas kyang ma yin /
translated: nor does it arise from both existence and nonexistence.üîΩHow is it that it does not arise from existence?

original: med pas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: med pas kyang ma yin /
translated: How is it that it does not arise from nonexistence?

original: yod @19b med du gyur pas kyang mi 'byung ba de bzhin du /üîΩyod pas kyang ma yin /üîΩmed pas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: yod @19b med du gyur pas kyang mi 'byung ba de bzhin du / yod pas kyang ma yin / med pas kyang ma yin /
translated: Just as it does not arise from existence or nonexistence,üîΩit is not reversed from existence,

original: yod med du gyur pas kyang mi ldog ste /
analyzed: yod med du gyur pas kyang mi ldog ste /
translated: not reversed from nonexistence,üîΩand not reversed from the combination of existence and nonexistence.

original: gzhan du na 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, the cessation of discrimination and feeling is called nirvana.

original: 'du shes de ni smig rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes de ni smig rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: That discrimination is like a mirage.

original: tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur lta bu'o //
translated: Feeling is like a water bubble.

original: smig rgyu dang / chu'i chu bur gyi 'byung ba dang / ldog pa ji lta bar 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: smig rgyu dang / chu'i chu bur gyi 'byung ba dang / ldog pa ji lta bar 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as a mirage and a water bubble arise and cease, so also is samsara and nirvana.

original: de'i phyir de zhi bar 'gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa ni tha snyad du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de zhi bar 'gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa ni tha snyad du ston pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the teaching of nirvana as peace is a conventional teaching.

original: byang chub sems dpas bcu po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi tha snyad du ston par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bcu po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi tha snyad du ston par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas should understand these ten as conventional teachings of the tathagatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas should understand emptiness through ten ways of engaging the way of Dharma.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩbdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / rje med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / phyed pa med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa dang / rje med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / phyed pa med pa dang /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag po med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po med pa'o //
translated: selflessness, the absence of sentient beings, the absence of life, the absence of individuals, the absence of owners, the absence of arising, the absence of cessation, the absence of effort, the absence of achievement, and the absence of master.

original: de la ji ltar na bdag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /üîΩstong pa nyid ni dngos po'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na bdag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na / stong pa nyid ni dngos po'ang ma yin /
translated: How should one understand emptiness through selflessness?

original: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is neither a thing nor a non-thing.

original: gal te ston pa nyid dngos po yin du zin na ni stong pa nyid 'dus byas dang / mi rtag par 'gyur ro //üîΩci ste stong pa nyid dngos po @20a *//
analyzed: gal te ston pa nyid dngos po yin du zin na ni stong pa nyid 'dus byas dang / mi rtag par 'gyur ro // ci ste stong pa nyid dngos po @20a *//
translated: If emptiness were a thing, emptiness would be conditioned and impermanent.

original: med pa yin du zin na ni stong pa mi stong par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa yin du zin na ni stong pa mi stong par 'gyur te /
translated: If emptiness were a non-thing, emptiness would not be empty.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dngos po'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dngos po'ang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, emptiness is not a thing.

original: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not a non-thing.

original: de ltar bdag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand emptiness through the non-existence of a self.

original: ji ltar na sems can med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems can med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand emptiness through the non-existence of sentient beings?

original: sems can ni stong pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sems can ni stong pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Sentient beings are not empty,

original: mi stong pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi stong pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor are they non-empty.

original: gal te sems can stong pa yin na ni srog gcod pa byas kyang sdig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sems can stong pa yin na ni srog gcod pa byas kyang sdig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If sentient beings were empty, then even if one committed murder, there would be no sin.

original: 'on te stong pa ma yin na ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te stong pa ma yin na ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not empty, then they would be permanent.

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sems can ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sems can ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One also said, ‚ÄúSentient beings are not permanent,

original: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: nor are they impermanent.

original: 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
translated: They are not conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin zhes gsungs te /
translated: nor are they unconditioned.‚Äù

original: de ltar na sems can med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems can med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand emptiness through the non-existence of sentient beings.

original: ji ltar na srog med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na srog med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the emptiness of the absence of a life-force?

original: stong pa nyid ni mi 'tsho mi 'chi'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mi 'tsho mi 'chi'o //
translated: Emptiness neither lives nor dies.

original: de la mig ni bdag dang / bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: de la mig ni bdag dang / bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: The eye is empty of self and what belongs to a self.

original: gang bdag dang / bdag gis stong pa de ni mi 'tsho mi 'chi'o //
analyzed: gang bdag dang / bdag gis stong pa de ni mi 'tsho mi 'chi'o //
translated: That which is empty of self and what belongs to a self neither lives nor dies.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni bdag dang / bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni bdag dang / bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: Similarly, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are empty of self and what belongs to a self.

original: gang bdag dang; bdag gis stong pa de ni mi 'tsho mi 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: gang bdag dang; bdag gis stong pa de ni mi 'tsho mi 'chi ba ste /
translated: That which is empty of self and what belongs to a self neither lives nor dies.

original: de ltar na srog med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na srog med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus should one understand the emptiness of the absence of a life-force.

original: de la ji ltar na gang zag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud @20b par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na gang zag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud @20b par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the emptiness of the absence of an individual?

original: stong pa nyid ni gang zag tu bgrang ba ma yin /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni gang zag tu bgrang ba ma yin /
translated: Emptiness is not counted as an individual.

original: stong pa nyid ni chos su bgrang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni chos su bgrang ba ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is not counted as a phenomenon.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams ni stong pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams ni stong pa yin te /
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres are empty.

original: de dag bzung nas gang zag ces lags so //
analyzed: de dag bzung nas gang zag ces lags so //
translated: and when they are grasped, there is the designation of a person.

original: gang bzung nas btags pa de ni yod pa dang / med pa zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang bzung nas btags pa de ni yod pa dang / med pa zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: But that which is grasped and designated should not be said to exist or not to exist.

original: de ltar gang zag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gang zag med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand emptiness as the non-existence of the person.

original: ji ltar na rje med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rje med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand emptiness as the non-existence of the master?

original: stong pa nyid las rnam par grol ba'i chos gang yang med pas gang stong pa nyid kyi rjer 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las rnam par grol ba'i chos gang yang med pas gang stong pa nyid kyi rjer 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang med de /
translated: There is no dharma whatsoever that is liberated from emptiness.

original: de ltar rje med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rje med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand emptiness as the non-existence of the master.

original: de la ji ltar na skye ba med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na skye ba med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand emptiness as the non-existence of arising?

original: stong pa nyid ni mi skye ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mi skye ste /
translated: Emptiness does not arise.

original: gal te stong pa nyid skye na ni stong pa nyid du mi 'gyur te; de ltar na stong pa ni stong pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid skye na ni stong pa nyid du mi 'gyur te; de ltar na stong pa ni stong pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If emptiness were to arise, it would not be emptiness, and thus emptiness would not be emptiness.

original: gal te skyes pa mi stong ste /
analyzed: gal te skyes pa mi stong ste /
translated: If the arisen were not empty,

original: stong pa nyid bdag nyid kyis skye na ni ma skyes pa de mi stong par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bdag nyid kyis skye na ni ma skyes pa de mi stong par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If emptiness were to arise by way of its own intrinsic reality, then that which is not arisen would not be empty.

original: de ltar skye ba med pas stong pa nyid skye na ni stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar skye ba med pas stong pa nyid skye na ni stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In that way, if emptiness were to arise, emptiness should be understood as non-arisen.

original: ji ltar 'gag pa med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gag pa med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should emptiness be understood as unceasing?

original: gang skye ba de ni 'gag ste /
analyzed: gang skye ba de ni 'gag ste /
translated: Whatever arises ceases.

original: stong pa nyid ni skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness does not arise.

original: gang mi skye ba de ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang mi skye ba de ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: How could that which does not arise cease?

original: de ltar 'gag pa med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //üîΩji ltar mngon par 'du mi byed pas stong pa nyid khong du @21a *//
analyzed: de ltar 'gag pa med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o // ji ltar mngon par 'du mi byed pas stong pa nyid khong du @21a *//
translated: In that way, emptiness should be understood as unceasing.

original: chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should emptiness be understood as unconditioned?

original: stong pa nyid ni mi bya mi byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mi bya mi byed do //
translated: Emptiness does not act, nor is it acted upon.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams ni stong pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams ni stong pa yin te /
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases are empty.

original: de dag gzung nas stong pa nyid du 'dogs so //
analyzed: de dag gzung nas stong pa nyid du 'dogs so //
translated: Having apprehended them, emptiness is designated.

original: de ltar mngon par 'du mi byed pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par 'du mi byed pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand emptiness as non-conditioning.

original: ji ltar na byed pa med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byed pa med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúHow should one understand emptiness as non-action?

original: stong pa nyid ni gang gis kyang 'di lta 'di lta bur gyis shig ces byed du gzhug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni gang gis kyang 'di lta 'di lta bur gyis shig ces byed du gzhug pa ma yin te /
translated: Emptiness cannot be made to do anything by anyone, saying, ‚ÄòDo it this way, do it that way.‚Äô

original: de ltar byed pa med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand emptiness as non-action.

original: ji ltar na bdag po med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag po med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúHow should one understand emptiness as ownerless?

original: stong pa nyid ni yul ma yin zhing yul med pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni yul ma yin zhing yul med pa /
translated: Emptiness is not an object, nor is it without an object.

original: sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: It is free from mind, mentality, and consciousness.

original: de ltar bdag po med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag po med pas stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand emptiness as ownerless.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug par bcu po de dag gis stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug par bcu po de dag gis stong pa nyid khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: bodhisattvas should understand emptiness through these ten aspects of the way of phenomena.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva should understand emptiness by means of ten kinds of entry into the principle of Dharma.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: ma rig pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / sred pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / las mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / rnam par shes pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / len pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / lta ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / sred pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / las mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / rnam par shes pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / len pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / lta ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang /
translated: the entry into the principle of Dharma as the counteragent to ignorance, the entry into the principle of Dharma as the counteragent to craving, the entry into the principle of Dharma as the counteragent to action, the entry into the principle of Dharma as the counteragent to consciousness, the entry into the principle of Dharma as the counteragent to grasping, the entry into the principle of Dharma as the counteragent to views,

original: @21b the tshom mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / nga rgyal mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / rgod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: @21b the tshom mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / nga rgyal mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / rgod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: the entry into the principle of Dharma as the counteragent to doubt, the entry into the principle of Dharma as the counteragent to the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices, the entry into the principle of Dharma as the counteragent to pride, and the entry into the principle of Dharma as the counteragent to frivolity.

original: rnam pa bcu po de dag ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po de dag ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: These ten aspects are the counteragents to the ten kinds of emptiness.

original: de la ma rig pa ni gnyis su bgrang ba dang / rnam par bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni gnyis su bgrang ba dang / rnam par bzhi'o //
translated: In this regard, ignorance is twofold and fourfold.

original: gnyis su bgrang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis su bgrang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is twofold?

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib par bgrang ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib par bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib par bgrang ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib par bgrang ba'o //
translated: They are counted as afflictive obstructions and as obstructions to omniscience.

original: de la rnam par bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'dod pa la mngon par chags pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / gzugs la mngon par chags pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / gzugs med pa la mngon par chags pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dngos po med pa la mngon par chags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la mngon par chags pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / gzugs la mngon par chags pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / gzugs med pa la mngon par chags pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dngos po med pa la mngon par chags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: They are the four that arise from the cause of attachment to desire, the cause of attachment to form, the cause of attachment to formlessness, and the cause of attachment to non-entity.

original: de la sred pa ni gzhi gnyis dang / rnam pa bzhi ste; gzhi gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sred pa ni gzhi gnyis dang / rnam pa bzhi ste; gzhi gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: Here, craving has two bases and four aspects. What are the two bases?

original: srid pa'i gzhi dang / longs spyod kyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i gzhi dang / longs spyod kyi gzhi'o //
translated: They are the base of existence and the base of enjoyment.

original: rnam pa gzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four aspects?

original: 'dod pa la sred pa dang / gzugs la sred pa dang / gzugs med pa la sred pa dang / dngos po med pa la sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sred pa dang / gzugs la sred pa dang / gzugs med pa la sred pa dang / dngos po med pa la sred pa'o //
translated: They are craving for desire, craving for form, craving for formlessness, and craving for non-entity.

original: de la las ni ldang ba gcig dang / rnam par gsum dang / rnam par smin pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la las ni ldang ba gcig dang / rnam par gsum dang / rnam par smin pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, karma has one arising, three aspects, and three fruitions.

original: de la ldang ba gcig gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ldang ba gcig gang zhe na /
translated: What is a single arising?

original: yid kyi las so //
analyzed: yid kyi las so //
translated: It is mental action.

original: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds?

original: lus las byung ba dang / ngag las byung ba dang / sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: lus las byung ba dang / ngag las byung ba dang / sems las byung ba'o //
translated: They are bodily action, vocal action, and mental action.

original: de la rnam par smin pa gsum gang zhe na /üîΩgnag la @22a *//
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa gsum gang zhe na / gnag la @22a *//
translated: What are the three kinds of retribution?üîΩThey are black with black retribution,

original: rnam par smin pa gnag pa dang / dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba dang / dkar gnag 'dren ma la rnam par smin pa dkar gnag 'dren ma'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa gnag pa dang / dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba dang / dkar gnag 'dren ma la rnam par smin pa dkar gnag 'dren ma'o //
translated: white with white retribution, and mixed with mixed retribution.

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: What are the six kinds of consciousness?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnams par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnams par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: They are visual consciousness, auditory consciousness, olfactory consciousness, gustatory consciousness, tactile consciousness, and mental consciousness.

original: rnam pa drug po de dag ni rnam pra shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug po de dag ni rnam pra shes pa ste /
translated: These six are consciousnesses.

original: phyin ci log la dmigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log la dmigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: They are the consciousnesses that have a false object, the consciousnesses that have a true object, and the consciousnesses that have no object.

original: de la phyin ci log la dmigs pa ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnam par g-yengs pa sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams kyi 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la phyin ci log la dmigs pa ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnam par g-yengs pa sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams kyi 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: The object of error is the cause of the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm for the confused, childish, ordinary beings whose minds are erroneous.

original: phyin ci ma log pa la dmigs pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //üîΩde gnyi ga las rnam par grol ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dmigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa la dmigs pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o // de gnyi ga las rnam par grol ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dmigs pa med pa ste /
translated: The object of non-error is the cause of the nirvƒÅ·πáa of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The object of both is the cause of the buddhadharmas for the bodhisattvas.

original: de la len pa ni srid pa'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la len pa ni srid pa'i rgyu rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, appropriation is the four kinds of causes of existence:

original: 'dod pa'i len pa dang / lta ba'i len pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs kyi len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i len pa dang / lta ba'i len pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs kyi len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i len pa'o //
translated: the appropriation of desire, the appropriation of views, the appropriation of morality and vows, and the appropriation of the doctrine of self.

original: de la lta ba ni rnam par gnyis te /
analyzed: de la lta ba ni rnam par gnyis te /
translated: Therein, views are twofold:

original: log pa'i shes pa can dang / dmigs @22b pa can no //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa can dang / dmigs @22b pa can no //
translated: those of the wrong philosophers and those of the realists.

original: de la log pa'i shes pa can ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la log pa'i shes pa can ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: The one with perverted cognition is the one with perverted views.

original: dmigs pa can ni tha na mya ngan las 'das pa la 'ang dmigs shing mngon par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa can ni tha na mya ngan las 'das pa la 'ang dmigs shing mngon par dga' ba ste /
translated: The one with an objective support is the one who, even at the end, has an objective support and delights in nirvana.

original: 'di ni dmigs pa can sangs rgyas rnams kyis smad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs pa can sangs rgyas rnams kyis smad pa'o //
translated: This is the one with an objective support who is despised by the Buddhas.

original: de la the tshom ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la the tshom ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Doubt is twofold:

original: theg pa'i bar du gcod pa dang / nges par gyur pa'i bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa'i bar du gcod pa dang / nges par gyur pa'i bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: doubt that is an obstacle to the vehicle and doubt that is an obstacle to the certain.

original: de la theg pa'i bar du gcod pa'i the tshom ni the tshom gang gis myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub sems pa la the tshom za ba ste /
analyzed: de la theg pa'i bar du gcod pa'i the tshom ni the tshom gang gis myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub sems pa la the tshom za ba ste /
translated: Doubt that is an obstacle to the vehicle is the doubt that quickly causes one to doubt complete enlightenment.

original: ha cang yang yun ring por bsdad pa 'dis ci zhig byas /üîΩnyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: ha cang yang yun ring por bsdad pa 'dis ci zhig byas / nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: What is the use of staying here for such a long time?üîΩI will quickly put an end to suffering in the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakasüîΩor in the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg par myur ba myur bar sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ngo snyam nas theg pa chen po spong ba 'di ni theg pa'i bar du gcod pa'i the tshom mo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg par myur ba myur bar sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ngo snyam nas theg pa chen po spong ba 'di ni theg pa'i bar du gcod pa'i the tshom mo //
translated: This is the doubt that is an obstacle to the vehicle.

original: de la nges par gyur ba'i bar du gcod pa'i theg tshom gang zhe na /üîΩthe tshom gang gis nges par gyur pa la mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de la nges par gyur ba'i bar du gcod pa'i theg tshom gang zhe na / the tshom gang gis nges par gyur pa la mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: What is doubt that obstructs the stage of certainty?üîΩIt is doubt that prevents one from entering the stage of certainty.

original: nges pa'i sa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni nges par gyur ba'i bar du gcod pa'i the tshom ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i sa khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni nges par gyur ba'i bar du gcod pa'i the tshom ste /
translated: It is doubt that prevents one from penetrating the stage of certainty.

original: 'di ni the tshom rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni the tshom rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: This is the second kind of doubt.üîΩWhat is grasping at an extreme?

original: de la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa legs par spyad pa rnams las 'bras bu la smon pa ste /üîΩbdag sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa 'di dag gis lha'am /
analyzed: de la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa legs par spyad pa rnams las 'bras bu la smon pa ste / bdag sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa 'di dag gis lha'am /
translated: It is the desire for a result from good actions such as generosity, etc.üîΩIt is the desire to become a god or a human being through generosity, morality, etc.

original: lha la la zhig tu gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa thams cad ni log par smon pa ste /
analyzed: lha la la zhig tu gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa thams cad ni log par smon pa ste /
translated: All of these are false desires.

original: 'di ni mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde la nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni snyems @23a *//
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o // de la nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni snyems @23a *//
translated: This is called grasping at an extreme.üîΩWhat is pride?

original: pas nga rgyal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pas nga rgyal zhes bya ste /
translated: It is a swelling up of the mind.

original: 'di ni ngan no //
analyzed: 'di ni ngan no //
translated: It is a low state.

original: bdag ni btsun no //
analyzed: bdag ni btsun no //
translated: I am noble.

original: bdag ni de dang mnyam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag ni de dang mnyam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: I am equal to him, and so on.

original: snyems pa ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snyems pa ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Arrogance is called pride.

original: de la rgod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rgod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of agitation:

original: nyon mongs pa skyed pa dang / shin tu snyems pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skyed pa dang / shin tu snyems pa'o //
translated: arousing afflictions and being very conceited.

original: de la nyon mongs pa skyed pa ni gzugs la gtsang bar yongs su brtags nas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis 'gal bar spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa skyed pa ni gzugs la gtsang bar yongs su brtags nas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis 'gal bar spyod pa ste /
translated: Among them, arousing afflictions is when, having imagined form to be pure, one engages in misconduct with body, speech, and mind.

original: gang 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is despised by the noble ones.

original: de la shin tu snyems pa ni nges par 'byin pa'i lam de nyid la shin tu snyems pa dang / shin tu rgyug pa dang / bdag nyid snyems pa ste /
analyzed: de la shin tu snyems pa ni nges par 'byin pa'i lam de nyid la shin tu snyems pa dang / shin tu rgyug pa dang / bdag nyid snyems pa ste /
translated: Among them, being very conceited is being very conceited, very excited, and conceited about oneself towards that very path of deliverance.

original: 'di ni rgod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called agitation.

original: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcu po de dag gis stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs khong du chud par bya'o ////üîΩbam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcu po de dag gis stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs khong du chud par bya'o //// bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Bodhisattvas should understand emptiness's counteragents through these ten principles of the way of Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya ste; bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas chos kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcus stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya ste; bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are those ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mi 'phrogs pa dang / rnam par mi 'gro ba dang / chags pa med cing chags pa dang bral ba'ang ma yin pa dang / 'jug pa med cing ldog pa med pa dang / 'thab pa med cing rtsod pa med pa dang / bri ba med cing gang ba med pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa dang / rnam par mi 'gro ba dang / chags pa med cing chags pa dang bral ba'ang ma yin pa dang / 'jug pa med cing ldog pa med pa dang / 'thab pa med cing rtsod pa med pa dang / bri ba med cing gang ba med pa dang /
translated: (1) not being robbed, (2) not going, (3) not being attached and not being free from attachment, (4) not engaging and not disengaging, (5) not fighting and not arguing, (6) not diminishing and not increasing,

original: 'du byed thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'gag par bzod pa dang / chos gang yang so @23b so'i skye bo rnams kyis ma bskyed /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'gag par bzod pa dang / chos gang yang so @23b so'i skye bo rnams kyis ma bskyed /
translated: (7) being patient with the natural cessation of all formations, (8) not being frightened when hearing that no ordinary being has produced any phenomena

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma bkag go zhes thos na mi skrag pa dang / 'khor ba'i rang bzhin dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin de dag mtshungs so zhes thos na the tshom mi za ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni rtag pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma bkag go zhes thos na mi skrag pa dang / 'khor ba'i rang bzhin dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin de dag mtshungs so zhes thos na the tshom mi za ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni rtag pa /
translated: and that no buddhas have stopped any phenomena, (9) not doubting when hearing that the nature of sa·πÉsƒÅra and the nature of nirvƒÅ·πáa are the same, and (10) not being afraid when hearing that the body of the tathƒÅgatas is permanent,

original: chos rnams ni mi zad pa'o zhes thos na 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams ni mi zad pa'o zhes thos na 'jug pa'o //
translated: He is one who has entered the Dharma when he hears that phenomena are inexhaustible.

original: de la ji ltar na mi 'phrogs pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na mi 'phrogs pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the one who speaks of emptiness as being unassailable?

original: stong pa nyid smra ba ni mi gnas pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi 'phrogs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid smra ba ni mi gnas pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi 'phrogs te /
translated: The one who speaks of emptiness is unassailable by worldly dharmas because he does not dwell on them.

original: rnyed pas dga' ba'ang med /üîΩma rnyed pas mi dga' ba'ang med /üîΩgrags pas yid sos pa'ang med /
analyzed: rnyed pas dga' ba'ang med / ma rnyed pas mi dga' ba'ang med / grags pas yid sos pa'ang med /
translated: He is not pleased by gain.üîΩHe is not displeased by loss.üîΩHe is not elated by fame.

original: ma grags pas sro shi ba'ang med /üîΩsmad pas zhum pa'ang med /
analyzed: ma grags pas sro shi ba'ang med / smad pas zhum pa'ang med /
translated: He is not depressed by lack of fame.üîΩHe is not discouraged by criticism.

original: bstod pas dga' bar sems pa'ang med /
analyzed: bstod pas dga' bar sems pa'ang med /
translated: He is not pleased by praise.üîΩHe is not attached to pleasure.

original: bde bas chags par 'gyur ba'ang med; sdug bsngal bas yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'ang med de /üîΩgang de ltar 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa de ni stong pa nyid shes pa ste /
analyzed: bde bas chags par 'gyur ba'ang med; sdug bsngal bas yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'ang med de / gang de ltar 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa de ni stong pa nyid shes pa ste /
translated: He is not repelled by suffering.üîΩThe one who is unassailable by worldly dharmas in this way knows emptiness.

original: de ltar mi 'phrogs pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'phrogs pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus should one understand the one who speaks of emptiness as being unassailable.

original: ji ltar na rnam par mi 'gro bas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par mi 'gro bas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the one who speaks of emptiness as not going anywhere?

original: stong pa nyid smra ba ni gang nas kyang rnam par mi 'gro /
analyzed: stong pa nyid smra ba ni gang nas kyang rnam par mi 'gro /
translated: The one who speaks of emptiness does not go anywhere at all.

original: gang du'ang rnam par mi 'gro /
analyzed: gang du'ang rnam par mi 'gro /
translated: He does not go anywhere.

original: de gang nas rnam par 'gro ba dang / gang du rnam par 'gro ba de stong pa nyid du mthong /
analyzed: de gang nas rnam par 'gro ba dang / gang du rnam par 'gro ba de stong pa nyid du mthong /
translated: He sees that wherever he goes, it is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid du shes so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du shes so //
translated: He knows that it is emptiness.

original: gang mi 'gro /
analyzed: gang mi 'gro /
translated: He knows that wherever he does not go,

original: rnam par mi 'gro ba de'ang stong pa @24a *//üîΩnyid du shes te /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'gro ba de'ang stong pa @24a *// nyid du shes te /
translated: and wherever he does not go, it is emptiness.

original: de ltar rnam par mi 'gro bas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya'o //üîΩji ltar na chags pa med cing chags pa dang bral ba'ang ma yin pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi 'gro bas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya'o // ji ltar na chags pa med cing chags pa dang bral ba'ang ma yin pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: Thus should one understand the one who speaks of emptiness as not going anywhere.üîΩHow should one understand the one who speaks of emptiness as neither attached nor unattached?

original: stong pa nyid smra ba ni gang du'ang chags pa'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid smra ba ni gang du'ang chags pa'am /
translated: The one who speaks of emptiness is not attached anywhere,

original: mi chags pa med de /
analyzed: mi chags pa med de /
translated: nor is he unattached anywhere.

original: de gang la chags pa dang / gang la mi chags pa de stong pa nyid du shes; stong pa nyid du mthong zhing /
analyzed: de gang la chags pa dang / gang la mi chags pa de stong pa nyid du shes; stong pa nyid du mthong zhing /
translated: They know that whatever one is attached to and whatever one is not attached to is emptiness, and they see it as emptiness.

original: gang chos gang la chags pa dang / chags pa med pa de'ang stong pa nyid du shes te /
analyzed: gang chos gang la chags pa dang / chags pa med pa de'ang stong pa nyid du shes te /
translated: They know that whatever phenomena one is attached to and whatever phenomena one is not attached to are emptiness.

original: de ltar chags pa med cing chags pa dang bral ba'ang ma yin pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar chags pa med cing chags pa dang bral ba'ang ma yin pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, they should understand the teaching on emptiness, without attachment and without being free from attachment.

original: de la ji ltar na 'jug pa med cing ldog pa med pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na 'jug pa med cing ldog pa med pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúHow should they understand the teaching on emptiness, without engagement and without disengagement?

original: stong pa nyid smra ba ni gang du'ang mi 'jug /
analyzed: stong pa nyid smra ba ni gang du'ang mi 'jug /
translated: The teaching on emptiness is not engaged anywhere.

original: gang nas kyang mi ldog ste /
analyzed: gang nas kyang mi ldog ste /
translated: It does not disengage from anywhere.

original: de gang la 'jug pa dang / gang nas kyang ldog pa de stong pa nyid du shes /
analyzed: de gang la 'jug pa dang / gang nas kyang ldog pa de stong pa nyid du shes /
translated: They know that whatever is engaged and whatever disengages is emptiness, and they see it as emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid du mthong yang byang chub kyi tshogs rnams la mi 'jug pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du mthong yang byang chub kyi tshogs rnams la mi 'jug pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: Even though they see it as emptiness, they are not non-engaged in the accumulations for awakening.

original: gang de ltar 'jug pa de ni stong pa nyid shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang de ltar 'jug pa de ni stong pa nyid shes pa yin te /
translated: Whoever engages in that way knows emptiness.

original: de ltar 'jug pa med cing ldog pa med pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa med cing ldog pa med pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, since there is no engagement and no disengagement, one should understand the teaching of emptiness.

original: ji ltar na 'thab pa med cing rtsod pa med pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'thab pa med cing rtsod pa med pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the teaching of emptiness as being free from strife and dispute?

original: gang la la 'thab cing rtsod par byed pa des ni stong pa nyid mi shes te /üîΩde gang dang 'thab cing rtsod @24b par byed pa de stong pa nyid du shes /
analyzed: gang la la 'thab cing rtsod par byed pa des ni stong pa nyid mi shes te / de gang dang 'thab cing rtsod @24b par byed pa de stong pa nyid du shes /
translated: Whoever engages in strife and dispute does not understand emptiness.üîΩOne should understand that emptiness is what one is in strife and dispute with.

original: stong pa nyid du mthong ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du mthong ste /
translated: One should see that emptiness is what one is in strife and dispute with.

original: de ltar 'thab pa med cing rtsod pa med pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'thab pa med cing rtsod pa med pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, since there is no strife and no dispute, one should understand the teaching of emptiness.

original: ji ltar na bri ba med cing gang ba med pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na /üîΩstong pa nyid smra ba ni chos gang yang bri ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar na bri ba med cing gang ba med pas stong pa nyid smra ba khong du chud par bya zhe na / stong pa nyid smra ba ni chos gang yang bri ba'am /
